candidates.title: Bump tokio from 1.6.2 to 1.7.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

candidates.body:
Bumps [tokio](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio) from 1.6.2 to 1.7.0.
Release notes

Sourced from tokio's releases.

Tokio v1.7.0

1.7.0 (June 15, 2021)

Added

  • net: add named pipes on windows (#3760)
  • net: add TcpSocket from std::net::TcpStream conversion (#3838)
  • sync: add receiver_count to watch::Sender (#3729)
  • sync: export sync::notify::Notified future publicly (#3840)
  • tracing: instrument task wakers (#3836)

Fixed

  • macros: suppress clippy::default_numeric_fallback lint in generated code (#3831)
  • runtime: immediately drop new tasks when runtime is shut down (#3752)
  • sync: deprecate unused mpsc::RecvError type (#3833)

Documented

  • io: clarify EOF condition for AsyncReadExt::read_buf (#3850)
  • io: clarify limits on return values of AsyncWrite::poll_write (#3820)
  • sync: add examples to Semaphore (#3808)
Commits
  • 34c6a26 chore: prepare Tokio v1.7.0 (#3863)
  • 97e7830 net: provide NamedPipe{Client, Server} types and builders (#3760)
  • 606206e Merge branch 'tokio-1.6.x' into merge-1.6.x
  • 2c24a02 chore: re-enable test_socket_pair on FreeBSD (#3844)
  • f55b77a tracing: emit waker op as str instead as Debug (#3853)
  • 21de476 sync: export sync::notify::Notified future publicly (#3840)
  • cb147a2 sync: deprecate mpsc::RecvError (#3833)
  • f759240 chore: update version in README.md (#3851)
  • 2e44cd2 net: TcpSocket from std::net::TcpStream (#3838)
  • 2ab1fb0 sync: add examples to Semaphore (#3808)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=tokio&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=1.6.2&new-version=1.7.0)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---

candidates.title: Bump hyper from 0.14.7 to 0.14.8

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

candidates.body:
Bumps [hyper](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper) from 0.14.7 to 0.14.8.
Release notes

Sourced from hyper's releases.

v0.14.8

Features

  • client: allow to config http2 max concurrent reset streams (#2535) (b9916c41)
  • error: add Error::is_parse_too_large and Error::is_parse_status methods (#2538) (960a69a5)
  • http2:
    • Implement Client-side CONNECT support over HTTP/2 (#2523) (5442b6fa, closes #2508)
    • allow HTTP/2 requests by ALPN when http2_only is unset (#2527) (be9677a1)

Performance

  • http2: reduce amount of adaptive window pings as BDP stabilizes (#2550) (4cd06bf2)
Changelog

Sourced from hyper's changelog.

v0.14.8 (2021-05-25)

Features

  • client: allow to config http2 max concurrent reset streams (#2535) (b9916c41)
  • error: add Error::is_parse_too_large and Error::is_parse_status methods (#2538) (960a69a5)
  • http2:
    • Implement Client-side CONNECT support over HTTP/2 (#2523) (5442b6fa, closes #2508)
    • allow HTTP/2 requests by ALPN when http2_only is unset (#2527) (be9677a1)

Performance

  • http2: reduce amount of adaptive window pings as BDP stabilizes (#2550) (4cd06bf2)
Commits
  • e61b494 v0.14.8
  • 5442b6f feat(http2): Implement Client-side CONNECT support over HTTP/2 (#2523)
  • be9677a feat(http2): allow HTTP/2 requests by ALPN when http2_only is unset (#2527)
  • 4cd06bf perf(http2): slow adaptive window pings as the BDP stabilizes (#2550)
  • 960a69a feat(error): add Error::is_parse_too_large and Error::is_parse_status met...
  • b9916c4 feat(client): allow to config http2 max concurrent reset streams (#2535)
  • ccba59f docs(common): remove favicon doc from sync_wrapper module (#2548)
  • 8a05f8e docs(server): add bigger example to server module (#2539)
  • e79d093 docs(client): document the guarantees of cloning a Client (#2540)
  • d1d2f32 docs(headers): no_inline doc on HeaderMap (#2525)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=hyper&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=0.14.7&new-version=0.14.8)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. candidates.title: Bump rusqlite from 0.24.2 to 0.25.3

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Bumps [rusqlite](https://github.com/rusqlite/rusqlite) from 0.24.2 to 0.25.3.
Release notes

Sourced from rusqlite's releases.

v0.25.3

Equivalent to v0.25.2, but without the dramatic change to the default features.

0.25.0

  • BREAKING CHANGE: Overhaul parameter API #830 / #609
  • Add ToSql implementations for u64 and usize #826 / #821
  • Implement FromSql for u64, usize and f32, and ToSql for f32 #823 / #822 / #821
  • Reduce required lifetime in create_scalar_function #825
  • Expose query progress information and introduce Batch iterator #824 / #803
  • Add #[inline] and #[cold] in far more places #834
  • Fix create_collation #839
  • Remove #[non_exhaustive] attribute on IndexConstraintOp #840 / #783
  • Document that optional() requires import of trait rusqlite::OptionalExtension #842
  • Update time to appease deps.rs #849
  • Upgrade to bindgen 0.57
  • Improve busy handler documentation #854
  • Upgrade SQLite bundled version to 3.35.4
  • Expands/cleans up documentation. Also renames (and documents) the so-far-undocumented LIBSQLITE3_FLAGS. #861
  • Add get_connection method to function context #867
  • Fix smallvec version #896
  • BREAKING CHANGE: Pass context to aggregate init and finalize #866
  • BREAKING CHANGE: Rename get_raw to get_ref_unwrap and get_raw_checked to get_ref #838
  • BREAKING CHANGE: Fix DateTime format #886 / #885 + Leniently parse rfc3339 timezones #928
Commits
  • e7bb33a Bump to 0.25.3
  • fd070db bundled-full should not be a default feature
  • 97c81d6 Prep release 0.25.2
  • cdce753 Fix build on some older versions of Rust
  • ca7a28b update year in license file
  • cd40cc3 Rustfmt (#956)
  • 26f3e50 Upgrade to hashlink 0.7 (#955)
  • c33d6bf fix several typos
  • b8b1138 Add Statement::parameter_name
  • 9ea5e2f Prepare release of rusqlite 0.25.1 (#940)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

candidates.title: Upgrade all deps to Tokio v1
candidates.body:
With this PR, all deps are now fully up-to-date. 🎉 

Had to bump the minimum Rust version to 1.44 for Tokio.

candidates.title: Bump redis crate to v0.17.0
candidates.body:
`redis` v0.17.0 [added support for Redis 6 auth](https://github.com/mitsuhiko/redis-rs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#0170---2020-07-29), which many hosted Redis providers are now offering. The main feature of Redis 6 that portier is currently incompatible with is username/password auth.

This PR bumps the `redis` crate's version to the oldest version with support for Redis 6 auth. Versions v0.18 and v0.19 contain larger changes (including an upgrade to tokio v1), so I wanted to keep this update as small as possible since my Rust skills aren't that great.

Upgrading required a few changes:

1. `parse_redis_value_async` now expects a decoder as the first argument. In `redis`, this decoder comes from the `combine` crate, so that's been added as a dependency.
2. v0.17.0 also supports TLS connections, so the Rust compiler is ensuring that portier is handling that option. However, since adding those options would be a bit more complicated, I've simply returned an error stating that TLS connections aren't supported yet.
3. `pubsub.rs` was updated to authenticate with username/password when both are provided.

candidates.title: Replace err-derive with thiserror
candidates.body: The current maintainer of err-derive has soft-deprecated it in favour of thiserror, which is similar and more popular.

candidates.title: Upgrade dependencies, clippy fixes, add caching to CI
candidates.body:
Some of our deps required Rust 1.42, plus we now use `matches!` ourselves, so the minimum version was bumped.

I've also re-enabled clippy and fixed some new errors that were generated.

candidates.title: Additional email domain validation
candidates.body:
**EDIT: This description is old.** See: https://github.com/portier/portier-broker/pull/211#issuecomment-811704861

This is breaking and will require a 0.4 release.

This commit essentially reverts the email domain TLD validation, and moves it to a separate `DomainValidator` type allowing configuration (instead of the hardcoded list). This is also nice because `EmailAddress` is now again closer to our normalization spec.

`DomainValidator` also adds new stuff:

 - Validates against the [public suffix list](https://publicsuffix.org).
 - Adds simple allow/block-lists for email domains.

All of these lists can be read from files, and this has been extended to `allowed_origins`.
